item.title: Half life iOS
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
I actually thought the Quake port to the PSP was rather neat. I didn’t play it much because it was a bit awkward, but it worked well enough and the framerate was solid.

Yobym:

I belive that steam on the ps vita would be a good idea. I sort of wondered like what fun it would be to have gmod on the ps vita, but then I realized how much of a pain it would be with the controls.

The controls on the Vita would actually suit gmod well, what with all the menus and gmod using the mouse pointer for some things, I could see the touch screen being very nice for that.

If Valve continues backing Sony as their console developer of choice (bscly as long as Sony keeps the money flowing) I would love to see some Source games on my Vita. Many of the games the system has are good, but it does need more if Sony plans on competing with Nintendo, so why not ask Valve what they think about it?

item.title: Half life iOS
item.dc:creator: somewhere_in_new_mex
item.description:
Valve isn’t interested in portable games anyway.

Now, maybe the iPhone isn’t the best choice for a FPS, but what about the smartphone-like Vita? Not to be too off-topic, but think about it- it has buttons and analog sticks. If Valve changes their mind about portable games, my money’s on the Vita as their choice. It wouldn’t be that different than using a PS3 or XBOX controller. Valve and Apple don’t really mix- or to be more precise, apples would just get caught in the valves and clog up the pipes. Also, HL on the Vita would really boost sales of the system- it really needs that now. Even if they only released HL and nothing else on the Vita just for nostalgia, I’d be happy with it.

item.title: Half life iOS
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
I’m genuinely impressed at the graphics those iOS devices manage, but the control scheme would be horrible. I genuinely think most of these mobile developers need to rethink their game genres much more towards something fitting of a touch-screen; management games, things that mostly involve slowly-made decisions by touching the screen from a menu. They can still be graphically impressive, I just find high-paced action doesn’t work on a touchscreen.

I actually bought Sid Meier’s Pirates on my WP7, and was delighted to find it was pretty much the whole game, fully playable, with nothing cut out - it just fits the platform well.
